resume.description: Build a professional resume step-by-step with our guided tool.

Personal_Information.short_desc: Include your full name, phone number, email address, and additional links

p: Your name and personal information are the first things employers will see on your resume. This section is crucial because it allows potential employers to contact you for interviews or follow-ups. Make sure your information is accurate, professional, and up to date.

tips.title: Use a clear, readable font
tips.caption: Choose a professional font to ensure your name and contact info are easy to read

tips.title: Have a professional email
tips.caption: Use a simple, name-based email instead of a casual or outdated address

tips.title: Include your LinkedIn/portfolio
tips.caption: Add links to your LinkedIn or portfolio to showcase your work

resources.resource_title: Including Personal Details on Your Resume
How to Write a Resume Personal Statement

p: List your most recent educational experiences first. Include the institution name, degree obtained, field of study, and graduation date.
Focus on education that supports the type of position you are applying for.

tips.title: Order by most recent
tips.caption: Always list your latest education first to make it easy to follow.

tips.title: Include relevant coursework
tips.caption: Add specific courses that are related to the job you are applying for.

resources.resource_title: How to List Education on a Resume

Experience.short_desc: Highlight your past job roles and responsibilities

p: Describe your previous jobs starting from the most recent one. Mention your title, employer, dates of employment, and key achievements.
Use action verbs to show your contributions.

tips.title: Use bullet points
tips.caption: Bullet points make your resume easier to read.

tips.title: Quantify achievements
tips.caption: Use numbers and metrics to highlight your impact.

resources.resource_title: How to Describe Work Experience on a Resume

Skills.short_desc: Showcase your technical and soft skills

p: Skills help employers quickly see if you meet their needs. Include a mix of hard and soft skills relevant to the job.
Group skills by category if you have many.

tips.title: Tailor skills to the job
tips.caption: Focus on skills that are listed in the job description.

tips.title: Keep it concise
tips.caption: List only the skills you are confident in using professionally.

resources.resource_title: Top Skills to Include on Your Resume

Proofread.short_desc: Check for errors and polish your resume

p: Review your resume carefully to catch typos, grammatical errors, and formatting issues.
Ask a friend or mentor to review it for a second opinion.

tips.title: Read aloud
tips.caption: Reading your resume aloud can help catch awkward phrasing.

tips.title: Use spellcheck tools
tips.caption: Tools like Grammarly can catch mistakes you might miss.
